An anime based on a video game, it's really solid and contains a lot of surprises for the ones who played the video game(like myself for example), it's really loyal to it's source material and contains a few extras, even tough it's compared to Attack On Titan for the whole walled city theme, they contain a different focus when the plot develops.
The art is unique, looks a lot like the game art, I could say something I've never seen in any other anime.
The music is awesome, also the mixing and voice acting is really good, you feel immersed in the whole action.
The characters develop somehowslowly towards the end, there are some bad asses moments for each but still it I would say it's up to the viewer the perception they have on them, overall the show is enjoyable with many feels.\n\n
If you are into the apocalyptic setting and some gore, this is for you, I recommend to have patience for the series because the development can be slow for some part but it's a completely rewarding with many unique moments.

Now LA knows what your gonna say, this is like ''Attack on Titan'', but with "Aragami's", instead of Titans, and LA knows, LA had the same vibes of it too, however where it diverges is the storyline format of it.
Death in this anime is rampant from red shirt civilians to main casts death and like ''Attack on Titan'' Episode 1, they pull on your heartstrings for this. 
Character-wise, they give the main cast as much development or obstacles as they can however it's only one episode each except for Lenka, Lindow Amamiya voiced by ''Hiroaki Hirata'' and Alisa Illinichina Amiella voiced by ''Maaya Sakamoto'', withLenka changing and evolving the most from the "typical Eren Yeager" to a strong-willed leader-like protagonist. 


This anime adaptation is an adaptation from the same PSP game series however LA will talk about that and the main plot in a bit but first.


The animation and music for this anime although many people dismiss the change in style that ufotable has taken with this anime series, LA says that the animation is taken from the game series animation in less polygonal style and more watercolored in a ways which complemented the bleak world of God Eater and LA praise the animation for it as the battle scenes in God Eater are AMAZING, every fluid movement to the changing of the God Arcs done by ufotable is like the quality LA expected, there is CGI used in this anime mainly on the God Arc's and the Aragami's however LA can easily ignore it as ''they are meant to be like this'', the God Arc's are mechanical thus CGI compliments it, the Aragami are meant to be "monsters from another world" thus again the CGI works on their favour and along with the watercolored textures on them compliments the already bleak world. ufotable once again uses CGI to it's fullest effect (last time being Berserker from Fate/Zero) as to not make the CGI standout but disguise it within it's environment or make it more alien as intended and not to tamper with it's slick character designs.


The music given gives ambience to atmospheric quality depending if it's a dramatic or battle or even sombre.


The voice acting through the board is top quality so LA won't talk much on this.


God Eater has been plagued with delays which is why the "release" of this anime was split by a 2 season gap and by all means if ufotable was having problems in development, it does go to show that a powerhouse animation studio like ufotable can be into trouble sometimes but LA can easily go on the offensive and say that at least at the VERY least they WANTED to finish this series.


The ending was utterly great with not only a great climatic battle but also a plot twist that makes the story go full circle, the plot didn't end per say but it ended on a very satisfying note. Now remember what LA said about this being a video game adaptation and how LA would be talking about the plot of this anime?. Well LA will say this, LA will praise this adaptation for trying to adapt it as well as it did from it's animation to trying to make use of it's game storyline to the fullest and even with it's faults of a "typical Attack on Titan" to "another Eren Yeager" to heck even rigid story telling of it's main cast cept for a fair few but with this anime's massive world building and goals of Fenrir helps us be immersed in this bleak world and even the main cast deaths are taken not in mourning or plot armour but more in a ways of moving on the legacy of that character to someone else.


Yes, LA will defend this anime for what it does "new" to it's "typical attack on Titan setting" and character and massive world development. Is this a bad video game anime adaptation?...well for LA, it has it's flaws, but considering what LA said, LA still enjoyed it even when it was delayed and even the ending was well worth the wait that made it one hell of ride to watch. God Eater looks to be something of a change to video game anime adaptations...LA just hopes other video game adaptation will see this as the NORM not the exception.

This is my review of the first season of the show and while there where delays and production issues I wont let that effect my scoring of the show as that wont apply to people who will watch the show in one sitting. When I started watching god eater I was expecting something different to Ufotables usual fate stay night type work which is all about stories where people are betraying or crossing one another in beautiful animation filled fights. I knew what God eater was before watching the show and it has met and gone over my expectations which would have been a eightoriginally. 


Story 9/10


The story in the first half is basic where it involves introducing some characters and world building. The story in general is basically moments of dialogue at home base between character with fights against monsters in between. The later half of the story is really good and and was able to make the pacing good for 13 episode series even with the flashbacks for the characters. My favorite episode apart from the final where the one that gave character development to Soma and the episode focused on Lenka the MC which was what I believe should have been the first episode of the series which is why I am giving it a  9 instead of 10. The story also has a combination of dark and epic moments that make you say WTF or Holy S&%t


Art 10/10


As expected of Ufotable they produce a series with a very good looking art style. The animation is mostly smooth and character and weapon designs are very detailed and shiny. The animation in the fight scenes are pretty good and dynamic. effects like fire, rain, blood are done nicely however electricity effects in the scenes they were used seem slightly overused and take away from everything else. The monsters in the series where mainly 3d CGI by the look of them but it wasn't bad CGI and didn't ruin what you where watching.


Sound 10/10


This was what I loved the most about the series considering I am going to buy GhostOracleDrive album and listen to it in college. The music that was used always seemed to fit the moment it was used. I usually watch a fight scene remembering the music as a few bangs and a small bit of dubstep however in this series I would mostly remember the epic song playing in the background. The music is also not only effectively used during fights it is effectively used during character dialogue.  


Character 8/10


The first squad characters are pretty well developed and sort of likable in the series as a whole but half of them at first can be very childish however to avoid spoilers I am not going to say who. The MC Lenka seems like the best character to get development in series. He is not a character in the god eater video games which the series is based off of as the games get you to create a main character to begin with. At first he seems like a blank slate as a character where he has nothing really interesting about him other then his need to kill aragami. Later on he does end up becoming my favorite character in the series after getting some decent development. My other favorite character in the series was Soma for similar reasons.


Enjoyment 10/10 


despite delays I really enjoyed every episode of this series mainly due to the pacing which wasn't too slow or too fast while keeping things entertaining. I would recommend this show as one you do watch in one sitting.  


Overall 9/10

I decided to do this anime some justice. If we want to name all the things, which remind us of some older anime - the main hero, Earth population wiped out, humanity's strongest captain, special battle equipement etc. - we're gonna be here forever. Let's move on. Let's call this a genre.
Honestly, I don't even think that SnK is first in this genre. It goes much further in the history of anime, like... 80s. All those huge aliens and mecha fighting, you know. There's basically nothing original about the Evangelion premise, right?
But what do all these stories have in common? We enjoy them! We enjoythose innocent children, who symbolize the future of humankind, fighting strange unknown evil, which is growing every day, causing everyone to fall into despair. That's why the number of those "generic" anime series keeps growing. And God Eater is doing a good job.


As soon as you get over the unoriginality, you will start to enjoy those little differences. There is nice story developement that even explains some of the past events. The main hero is not a complete good-for-nothing, he has some previous life experience (which reminds me a bit of Terra Formars and I do like that type of character). The amount of despair is... delightful. Well executed violence. Nothing is black and white, or more like: everything is dark. You are left wondering after every episode whether are there any chances of humanity surviving. Even the morally strong protagonists have major character flaws. Even the biggest hopes will be stained with bloody disillusion.


People here praise the animation. For me, it was one of the weakest aspects. It is undoubtedly well done, but it just feels weird to me. Distracting. Very CGI-like. One of those animes where you watch first episode and think: wait, is this... video game adaptation? Looks like it.


Anyway. If you can't get enough of action sci-fi shounen genre, go ahead and watch this! If you're looking for deep, thoughtful stories with delicately designed personalities and unusual enviroment, go search somewhere else.

god eater is a very enjoyable show, if you like post-apocalyptic mankind against monster type shows. the pace is fair, the art is great, and the show overall is quite good.
though many argue it's "resemblance" to attack on titan, god eater really sets itself apart by combining militaristic and scifi elements into a show that keeps you clicking "play next episode."
my biggest complaint is the stupid character designs that looks like characters are literally right out of kingdom hearts (kota) or some rave club dancer. this show does has it's fair amount of fan service and ill fitting costumes, but the show is mostly aboutmankind's struggle against extinction. the weapons as well are far fetched, but in the way guts' sword is in berserk. they're over the top. it's the future, and they're fighting giant monsters. and they look bad ass doing so.


i really appreciate that the show explains how the phenomenon of the coming of the arigami, and thus showing where mankind came from to where it has ended up, as well as to show a glimmer as to where it will go. the longer you watch the show, the more you see about how, or maybe why arigami came to be. they leave enough room for speculation, as well as give an idea for the mentalities of the remaining pieces of humanity.


the show also spends a fair amount of time developing each of the main characters. many times it's through single episodes, but the team is developed over time as they are shown from being weary working together, to fighting in unison.  it develops the love and admiration each character has for one another, in their own ways.


in all, i would recommend this show. fan of mankind versus extinction via monsters or not, god eater has elements in it that makes it an enjoyable watch for a lot of people. (imo)

*Spoiler Free Review*
God Eater stayed in my "plan to watch list" for a really long time. It was mostly because it was a CGI anime and also i thought that it had an interesting but ordinary story after reading the synopsis of it.
A week ago i finally started watching it. It started like an ordinary shounen anime but i think everything about the anime developed through the episodes.
First of all the animation didnt irritate me at all. I even liked it. After watching a few episodes i often forgot the fact that i was watching a CGI anime. I still prefer non CGI anime buti think this was also really well done.

Art: 9/10


Secondly yes, the story was an ordinary story. God Eater takes place in the future. In its world there are creatures that are called "aragami". Aragami eat everything and kills humans too. Humans try to survive. There are people called God Eaters. They are specialized soldiers who kill aragami.

Simple story right? But how it was told was really interesting i think. There were also some plot twists especially in the last episodes. Action scenes were nice but the anime wasnt all about action scenes. The characters were interesting. Many of them developed well. I felt bonded with many of the characters and got really sad because of some deaths. The only character who couldnt really satisfy me was alisa. Even though i thought she would be the main heroine in the first episodes and even though i thought she would have great character development, after a few episodes she became a side character who barely does something and she could never be able to get an important role after that. Some important things happened about her but i couldnt feel really satisfied with her character in general.

Story: 7-8/10

Characters: 8/10


I didnt really like the opening or ending musics but i didnt hate them either. 

I LOVED the insert songs. 

Sound: 9/10


I thought about giving 8/10 overally but especially the last episodes were great in my opinion thats why i am giving 9/10.

I know this is adapted from a game thats why it probably wont have a second season but i would love to see it.

Personally, I would give the series a 9 but it may seem biased since I was a fan of the original game. Therefore for everyone else, I would give it an 8
Before I start with my review, let me preface by saying that I did play the game before watching the anime so I do have some above-average knowledge of God Eater's lore and what was the game's biggest Wham moments. Though I have since put down the game for good and cannot for the life of me get back into playing it, I did enjoy the story and the cast. I find that GodEater's story is at the top of all Monster Hunter-clones (and is even better in that department when compared to any official Monster Hunter game)


When the anime was announced and said to be developed by Ufotable, I was ecstatic. Ufotable is hands-down my new favorite animation studio. I've been in love with their works since Kara no Kyoukai leading up to Fate/Zero and then finally with Unlimited Blade Works. It was a no-brainer that I give the God Eater anime a chance.


Now if you were following the anime at the same time as the original broadcast, I will admit that it was a horrible experience. With that much delay in-between episodes, the glamour of the series diminishes after each passing week. It's easy to believe that the God Eater anime sucks.


For a time, I did think same. I absolutely placed the series in the back of my mind. My thoughts at the time were that it was an unfortunate debacle. Ufotable did not seem to reach the lofty expectations fans set after enjoying all of their continually great series.


When the delayed episodes were announced to be broadcast without any breaks, I decided to binge watch every episode again.


I was shocked. When watching every episode back-to-back, the difference in terms of enjoyment was clearer than night and day.


I know now that the blame for the poor initial reception lies solely on the delay and not on the series itself.


The animation was never the problem. It was still as good as the day I first watched them and it's on par with all of their previous works


Of particular note here is the fight choreography. On my first viewing, I did not pay particular attention to them but they were much more amazing the second time. The fight on top of the airplane, the fight near the dam, the underground fight (where Lenka was coordinating things) and the fight in the final episode clearly stand out in my mind.


Story-wise, you should expect much of the same as with Unlimited Blade Works. To the uninformed, Ufotable expanded the original story, There were much more scenarios and development in the anime that were never in the original work. 


If you are a fan of the original work and are the type to hate it when the anime expands upon the story by creating new scenes, you might as well stop reading now.


Personally I really enjoyed it. The added scenarios created a new experience for me. Even though I was already spoiled from enjoying the game's original spoilers, I appreciated Ufotable by creating new surprises for me to enjoy.


In terms of character development, the original game focused on Alisa, Lindow and Soma. But here in the anime, those three are joined by Lenka and Johannes. The anime especially did a great job with Lenka and Johannes. Since Lenka was based on the blank Player Character of the game, there were a lot of ways they could have developed him. But I am quite pleased with the story they crafted. 


If you could only watch one episode of God Eater, then you should really watch Episode 10. It's one of the most heartbreaking episodes of any anime and was the reason I decided to give this series a second chance. 


And besides Lenka's developments, I also felt for Johannes. When you watch the anime as whole, you can truly feel that you now understand what makes him tick. His character journey is equally heartbreaking.


Lastly, there's the soundtrack. For the majority of the episodes, there is a very blood-pumping action-filled rock soundtrack on par with what the original game did. It's purpose is to tell you that a very cool fight is about to happen and it does it's job well. 


But what surprised me is the soundtrack they used during the quiet moments. It definitely grabs your attention and helps make you feel more for the characters. Of particular note is the entire soundtrack for episode 10. Ruined Land by Go Shiina feat. naomi is my new go-to feelz song.


So please, if you are a fan of the original game, a fan of Ufotable or are simply a fan of the action genre, please give this series a chance. Watching the series now that it's completed will not be a disappointment.


My only disappointment is that the anime stopped right before the Burst storyline. I truly feel that Ufotable may not get a second crack at the series and may not be able to create a second season finishing the original game's story. But I do feel that the anime stopped at a satisfying point. You can still watch this series and enjoy it for what it is.


(Besides MAL, I am also posting this review on Crunchyroll so please don't be alarmed)

This show is just as good as Attack on Titan. There. I said it. I used to think that this anime might be trying to piggyback off the success and provide something in the space between Attack on Titan season 2, but God Eater really does bring its own thing to the table.

There is also a different kind of story, different world building, and a much faster pace. It also has a different way of creating villains. I think that if you liked AttackOn Titan, you would like God Eater, but it is much more than off-brand Attack On Titan. \n
I want there to be another season of God Eater, just as I am sick of waiting for Attack on Titan season 2. You might have heard bad things about God Eater, but please just give it a watch. It might surprise you.

This anime is kind of epic. It's not the sort of thing I'd rewatch, but I do really wish that a second season was in the works. From what I gather, God Eater was based off of a game series, and this season was only made to promote God Eater 2 (the game). So, unfortunately, I don't think we'll get any more of this anime, which is a real shame. 
The animation style in God Eater kind of turned me off at first, but the more I got used to it, the more I was able to focus on the story. The main plot pointof saving civilization is not an original idea, but it is done well here. Not to mention, the battles were stunning. Both because of the characters and because of the animation (once I got used to it). 


Speaking of the characters, they're amazing. I wish, again, that we had more seasons so that we could get more development from them, but they were extremely well written. I'd say Lindow, Soma, and Lenka were my favorites. 


To wrap up, I'd recommend this anime to people that enjoy Attack on Titan and anime similar to that. Although, in my opinion, God Eater is slightly lighter that AoT, so if that appeals to you, there you go. I enjoyed this anime immensely, and I would definitely watch a second season should it appear at some point in the future. Here's hoping!

God Eater is a pretty good anime. First it got really nice art style. Something between drawing and cgi, works very well and makes it enjoyable to watch.
Story is interesting. The world is under attack by creatures called Aragami. Humanity is on the edge of extinction. The only way to fight those monsters is by merging humans with Aragami to create God Eaters. What I liked about the anime is the fact that we get the whole story. Every episode brings some more details about what happened and how Aragami attacked humanity. That gives it more depth that just fights with no purpose. 
As faras characters go we have our main guy - Lenka. He is well written character. Even thou he is special he is not full of himself, he works hard and he is a team player. Trough whole series he does not change his personality. \n
Apart from Lenka we got some other side characters that are also cool and add to the story.\n\n
Overall I can recommend this anime to everyone that is looking for some good action anime with good story with interesting characters.

I AM REVIEWING FROM A GAMER'S POINT OF VIEW SINCE I PLAYED THE GAMES FIRST
Story (SPOILERS): I loved God Eater's original story, however the anime obviously took different turns. First up, it might not have been the producer's fault, but the anime was TOO SHORT!!! I cut up the God Eater plot into 3 major points. One, Alisa's issue and Lindow going missing. Two, the protagonist is now captain and Johannes is going to use Shio to start the Devouring Apocalypse. Three, we stop Johannes but find out Lindow's alive so we save him; roll credits. The anime covered only 1/3 of the plot ANDrushed through it leaving out monumental parts. Not to mention, I feel like the political side of God Eater's story wasn't really important until the approaching 2nd game and certain aspects were conditioned or brought up too early. (For example, to those who played the older, not remade games, it's like when you have those Rank 1,2,3 missions targeting small fry and all of a sudden a big a** un-introduced Aragami pops up. Wait your turn, I don't KNOW what you are!!). They changed certain small facts here and there, but for the most part, they weren't that big of a deal.


Art: The setting designs were flawless, however the character design truly disappointed me and the Aragami rubbed me the wrong way. For those who were deep into the games plot, you'd know there was already a protagonist before Lenka Utsugi, named Yuu Kannagi. I personally liked the design of Yuu Kannagi more than Utsugi's and believed they should've kept it. Other characters, like Alisa and Soma, were given a more outrageous alterations in the design that made them look like shiny, plastic action figures. God Eater isn't the first anime this design team worked on and some like the art, but I didn't. On the bright side, the fight scenes were very pleasing to the eye


Sound: I could't imagine a better soundtrack. There were scenes where I had trouble paying attention because the soundtrack was so cool and beautiful. Oldcodex's Feed A is one of my favorite songs and the ending theme wasn't bad either. Not to mention they flattered fans by bringing back classic songs like "No Way Back".


Character: Unfortunately, due to how short the anime was, certain important characters like Soma and Kota weren't given they're full development because the anime did not reach that part of the plot where they were truly involved. Alisa's story is one of the more important aspects of the anime and I feel like they strayed from the original (in a bad way) by emphasizing more aspects and cutting out others which eventually changed her general character. In the game, Alisa was more of a tsundere character that sometimes spoke before thinking and was self-driven, making her a good God Eater. However, the anime took out the tsundere feel to her and turned her into a callous, pragmatic kuudere full of hate who was just naturally talented and hid her flaws. And deep down, she was nothing more than a weak, unreliable little girl. I feel like the game handled it better. And now, for the elephant in the room: Lenka Utsugi. For the most part, the game protagonist is silent and not much is said on Yuu Kannagi's past in the manga. And although I did not like Utsugi's design, I feel like the past he was given was interesting and one deserving of a main character.


Enjoyment: Although I HIGHLY RECOMMEND PLAYING THE GAME FOR A BETTER STORY AND EXPERIENCE, the anime kept me busy and the fight scenes were stunning and well portrayed

After seeing some of the total crap reviews of this anime, I felt inclined to do one of my own.
I won't summarize sections, let's just say of all the categories none received below a 9 for me.  Chars, story, art, etc...all great.
For the fanboys rating this anime down because it has similarities to Attack on Titan, such as humanity dying off so are living in a walled in area to be safe....  Get over yourself, that's in a MILLION animes and movies, and guess what Attack on Titan wasn't the first.  You'd know that if you didn't have your head so farup AoT's butt that you can't even see the light of day anymore....


Moving on....the characters are good.  Sure some chars piss you off at times, they are supposed to though.  No one wants a show where everyone always does EXACTLY what we think they should do and never screws @#$% up.  I really liked several of the chars, even the female leads some folks are griping about.  Also whoever said the acting was bad HAD to be having a stroke when they watched it or watched the English dubbed version...which who are we kidding, 99.9995% of all English dubbed animes have worse than crap acting, no shocker there, that's why you should just watch the subbed version....it's GREAT.


I for one, actually prefer this anime over AoT (and I'm not saying that because I dislike AoT....because I don't, i actually REALLY enjoy it a lot - just being honest).  For one, I like the lack of zip line fighting and not having too see some of the dumbest looking twats running around nude as "titans" just makes this more appealing to me.  


This anime while, agree there are some BROAD similarities is NOT Attack on Titan...you can watch both animes, and enjoy the hell out of both, never once feeling like "oh I've seen this before", etc...  They are truly both unique in their own right, within their own stories ... especially how the heroes totally differ in their abilities and power to be able to fight back.  The stories are truly are quite different once you realize that just because it's an end of the world / let's save humanity scenario doesn't make the other 90% of the story that's told have to be the same as other shows with that general premise, because it's not.


Long story short....this is a GREAT anime.  VERY much worth a watch, so ignore some of the harsh ratings on here, those folks clearly just don't like this sort of thing (which is fine, to each their own), are too much of AoT fanboys to even enjoy anything else, or were experiencing that time of month when they wrote their review.  So...ignore their BS, hell ignore mine if you want, but at least watch the anime and make your own choice...it's worth the watch and I think you'll be glad you did.

Based by the game for PSP, God Eater. This is one of the few anime adaptions from the game that I find attachment to it. 
* Story (9) - The series start with a slow pace, focusing on how the main character, Lenka will face his own struggles on defeating the Aragami. Later on the anime is starting to pick up a reasonable pace where we are greeted by more fighting. 
What I like about this anime is that they actually try and give the main character a background story which is not available on the game. The ending will give you the feeling ofhaving a season 02 but I seriously doubt it. 


* Art (10) - The first time I saw this anime, it has the 3D feel to it, but it surprisingly fit in. This will seriously stay in your mind for awhile because of its unusual art style and the way it is animated. 


Characters looked entirely different and you can easily remember their names as well. Background, there's nothing much we can do about it because the humans are technically on the brink of destruction thanks to the Aragami,


* Sound (10) - VAs of this anime did a job well done. It feels like their voices suited the characters. The acting is also believable like they pour their emotions as if they were the characters themselves. They didn't overreact. They reacted like the way we should have acted. 


* Character (10) - There are some major and minor character developments, but none is left behind. Every character has faced some hardships with life and they have to deal with it of course. 


Some characters you may find it annoying or cringeworthy to watch but sometimes we have to understand that they faced some hardships and they do often overreact because they are tired or traumatized. 


* Enjoyment (10) - Even though I give it a perfect score, it is not exactly the anime I would rewatcha fter a month or so, because the anime can give a big impact or little impact that you may forgot what the anime is all about. 


The reason behind the perfect score, it is because until now, I still remember how the protagonists react to one another or to a battle and such. It has taken a place of my mind and that is like   6 - 7 months ago. 


Overall rating is 10 - They did a good job on trying their best to make the anime realistically enough for us viewers. If you know the game, then you should also know that they changed some things from the anime to make it more logical for us. I think you will know what I mean if you did some research of the game itself.

'God Eater' - An exceptionally animated 13 episode series set in an apocalyptic, futuristic environment, based on the 2010 video game of a similar name. 
My first statement on the show is that of a warning; this series does not have astounding character development, nor does it have a particularly memorable story or ending. The reason why I feel the need to make this review is because although the series lacks in those features, it compensates in some of the best animation and sound I have experienced in an anime. 
Story - 5/10
The situation presented in God Eater is fairly unoriginal, and executed quite poorly.The protagonist Lenka Utsugi has a personal grudge against 'Aragami', fast evolving monsters that are effectively pushing the human race to the brink of extinction. Without going into too much detail, Utsugi has a special ability and uses this against the Aragami. As many of you will have realized, the setting is comparable to that of Shingeki no Kyojin, but unfortunately God Eater fails to reach the same story quality. The pacing felt unbalanced; there were several moments where I felt that too much happened in a short period of time, whilst other instances dragged out to an unnecessary degree. The end of the series was average, with an appropriate climax, but many loose ends and a lack of closure that would hint towards another season. 


Art/Animation - 9/10

This is where God Eater truly shows its strength. Facial emotions are conveyed perfectly, action sequences are animated beautifully and smoothly, and the backgrounds are nothing short being perfectly designed. If you can appreciate a unique yet astounding art-style, then God Eater's animation quality is the single reason good enough for me to recommend it.


Sound - 10/10

Like the art, the sound in God Eater reaches near perfection. The opening and closing themes flow perfectly and are engaging. The soundtrack used throughout the series effectively conveys and enhances emotions towards the viewer, whilst not feeling intrusive on the overall setting. Once again, I highly recommend this anime to those who appreciate great OST's. 


Character 6/10

Most of the characters within God Eater are not bad, nor are they exceptional. As the series progresses, more background information on the main characters are shown through flashbacks and episodes set in the past, but very little significant character development actually occurs. There were a few notable characters in the series, such as Rindou Amamiya, and Souma Schicksal voiced by the amazing Kazuya Nakai (Mugen from 'Samurai Champloo'). However, the character of Alisa Illinichina Amiella was the greatest shortcoming in the series, turning what could have been a great character with potential for development into a whiny, crying brat. She alone reduced my personal enjoyment of the series significantly. 


Enjoyment - 9/10

I approached this show with the mindset of 'this probably won't have a great story, but the animation will look good', and my expectations were thoroughly met. There were many literal jaw-dropping moments, and one scene in particular after the airplane sequence was possibly the best 5 seconds of anime I have experienced. To feel and relate the absolute hopelessness of the characters is something very few series can achieve, and this anime manages to do it. Enjoyment would have been another 10/10 if not for the constant pace shifts and the character of Alisa. 


Overall - 38/50

As stated throughout the review, I highly recommend this to people who enjoy great art-style and soundtracks. The story and characters are nothing special, but there are a few moments in which this anime conveys and afflicts the viewer with raw emotion perfectly. 


This was my first review, so apologies in advance if there was anything missing or incorrectly presented.

So God Eater is a post-apocalyptic anime about human fighters known as God Eaters that take on the monsters that kill humans known as the Aragami. It follows Lenka Utsugi, a human who commits himself into killing all of the Aragami. overall, is it worth watching? I will have to say it is.
Story: 8/10
The story is actually really good and is part of why this anime is worth watching. While is does seem to rip off from Attack on Titan and has the first two episodes losing its audience, the third episode brings in all the action needed to bring them back to their seatswatching the anime. 


Art: 10/10

Now this is the main reason to why this anime is worth watching! The art style is godlike in terms of amazement. The CGI is well done and not overused. The animation is spectacular, and overall, it seems different from the art of a lot of other anime, but in a great way, being close to realistic. Of course this is by none-other than Ufotable themselves who are also the makers of Fate/zero, and Fate/Stay Night: Unlimited Blade Works (series), two amazing anime.


The Sound: 7/10:

while I am not into anime soundtracks, I will admit that it had a decently good soundtrack, despite most of the songs with noticeable auto-tune voices. The opening song, Feed A by Oldcodex, is great, not only in tune, but also in fitting context. The ending song, Kouhai Chi by Go Shina feat. naomi, is a bore fest, but it fits with the dark theme, so points for that. 


Character: 8/10:

Yeah some points had to be cut off from this aspect because most of the characters seem to have personalities taken from Attack On Titan characters (e.g., Lenka Utsugi and Eren Jaeger, Alisa Illinichina Amiella and Mikasa Ackerman, Soma Schicksal and Levi Ackerman), but why the characters are the way they are, they are explained during the anime. Also, most of the characters are actually really likable, and Alisa, while wearing skimpy clothing, is not just there for fanservice as some might think of it to be, but is actually more as an important plot point for this anime. 


Enjoyment: 9/10:

With such great animation, badass fight scenes, showing the gore when it's needed, and an overall likable cast of characters, this anime is really enjoyable. 


Overall: 8.4/10

While this is not the best anime of all time, it is still a great anime to watch, great especially for the art style and animation.  In conclusion, this is a great anime adaptation of a video game and will go down as one of the best anime of 2015.

Based only on this anime alone, I thought it was pretty solid. Would watch again to be exact. Seeing how these reviews are going, it seems you have to compare this to other anime to clarify how good of an anime this is. If compared to other anime in its genre, it wouldn't stand as high as some of the other mainstream anime. It uses many of the generic baselines, IE: apocalypse wasteland, lust to get revenge, Kill all protect all ect ect.. If you solely watch the anime in an of it self, I personally think you'll thoroughly enjoy this anime!

God Eater is one of the more.. disappointing shows I've watched. Legendary Fate/Stay Night: Unlimited Blade Works/Heavens Feel and Kara no Kyoukai studio managed to certainly MAKE a story with the adaptation of the PlayStation Portable game of the same name, but after both watching the show and playing the game, I can't help but feel the show is the more inferior of the two, even with the gimped controls of the handheld.
A story that hops between plot points like an Olympic gymnast with little to no care of the actual chronological order of things, with bland character arcs that felt like their storyboards gotmixed around in the planning room, cop-outs that slap you in the face if you were expecting something that was supposed to happen and shove "Something Unexpected" into your hands and forces you to smile and say "thank you," but an interesting premise that I just hoped would have been handled better makes me give the story a 6.


The character designs were unique if at some points a bit risque, and the monster designs were faithfully adapted from the game. The world looks and feels like a completely barren wasteland, with only small refuges of humanity left. Ufotable ceases to fail in its art direction, so I give that a 9.


Feed A by OLDCODEX certainly captures the feel of what the show is SUPPOSED to be, a gritty fight for survival against insurmountable odds by those who are humanity's last protector, and Kouhai Chi by Go Shiina and naomi does a splendid job of instilling the hope that "maybe, just maybe they'll pull through." While Human After All by GHOST ORACLE DRIVE and BiSH tells you that this grueling endeavor is over and you can rest, for now. Outside of the music, the sound design for the Aragami are pleasantly recreated and upgraded from the game, so the sound design gets an 8.


Many of the characters from the God Eater video game return in the anime, minus item vendor and other, minor NPCs, so the only real original character here is the main character, Utsugi Lenka. A cardboard cutout with little to no character backstory, who fills the role of the main character I guess, seeing as the game had a custom character that you created. But, most if not all the character customization choices give your character in-game life, he/she isn't just some person whose goal is to kill Aragami, and the lack of certain characters makes the world feel a little less alive. In the game there were different character interactions depending on if you finished an important mission or not, ie. a little girl mourning a character's death, a guy having a crush on an operator, and cooperation with God Eaters' outside of the main cast are kept to a minimum or removed entirely. All that along with no more growth from any of the returning cast leaves the story at a 5.


I originally went into God Eater with the only knowledge of the ip being from when I saw around seven seconds of gameplay four years ago, so I wasn't expecting really much at all. I felt let down by the slow pacing yet the overarching story was what kept me from dropping it. Every episode has a flashback sequence which explains, over the course of the thirteen episodes, how the world came to be like it is. Which, is a good sentiment if everything wasn't in grayscale and exposition was handled by the characters better. And, when all was said and done and the credits rolled on the thirteenth episode I got my hands on the first game and became even more disappointed. So much potential could have been sought to fruition if the show was just a little bit more fast pace or just a couple of episodes longer. But, because this is the final product, I can't help but see a wasted chance for another great anime under Ufotable's belt, so my enjoyment was a 4.


Overall, God Eater was really middle of the road. Yes, it's an adaptation of a video game, but it didn't do as horribly as other adaptations. Yes God Eater itself is a relatively niche game so really only die-hard God Eater fans can enjoy God Eater to its fullest, but I feel when making a show like this niches shouldn't be specifically catered to. And yes the production and the action sequences were incredible, but the pacing and dialogue were flat, leaving only gore and fanservice to sate one while watching it. Finally, yes, CG can definitely be done horribly and ruin an experience, but despite the unnaturalness of seeing 3D CG, it feels like it belongs due to the unnaturalness of the Aragami. So, God Eater gets an overall 5 in my book.
